meanings.definition: The action of wearing away or changing the appearance or texture of something by long exposure to the atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The weatherings on the old statue made it look like it was melting.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the weatherings on the rocks near the beach smoothed out their rough edges.
meanings.sent3: The weatherings on the ancient building gave it a fashionable distressed look.
meanings.sent4: The weatherings on the metal gate revealed a history of countless storms and winds.
meanings.sent5: The weatherings on the wooden bench told stories of years gone by.

meanings.definition: The process of being worn away or changed by long exposure to the atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The weatherings of the cliffs by the sea were evidence of nature's constant work.
meanings.sent2: The weatherings of the signpost made it hard to read the directions.
meanings.sent3: The weatherings of the outdoor furniture made it seem like it had been through a lot.
meanings.sent4: The weatherings of time had a way of beautifying even the most rugged surfaces.
meanings.sent5: The weatherings on the mountain peaks gave them a majestic, timeless quality.
